intro: Chamaecytisus kreczetoviczii, commonly known as the Kreczetóczy broom, is a flowering shrub native to the Carpathian Mountains in Europe. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers in late spring, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
